  • ABOUT

NYC Department of Records Newsletter Manager

  • Project requirements
  • Comparison of existing open source products.

    1. Colossus

        Pros
      • Provide contact list management features (manage multiple contact lists)
      • Allow design of emails in application (WYSYWIG Editor)
      • Allow upload of HTML template in application (Copy & Paste)
      • Store newsletter statistics (delivery success / failures)
      • Permissions for sending, managing contact list, and editing / creating newsletters - Currently Admin Account
        Cons
      • Allow emails to be sent out - System has this feature but I haven't successfully sent.
      • Ability to provide attachments (custom or single attachment)
      • Login with NYC.ID

    2. Listmonk

      • Github Repository
        Pros
      • Allow emails to be sent out -- I don't know how to test it, but it works on editor's demo.
      • Allow design of emails in application (WYSYWIG Editor)
      • Allow upload of HTML template in application (Copy & Paste)
      • Ability to provide attachments (only pictures support here - there is an attachment button but it doesn't work)
      • Store newsletter statistics (delivery success / failures)
      • Permissions for sending, managing contact list, and editing / creating newsletters - Only Admin Account
        Cons
      • Login with NYC.ID

    3. Mail For Good

      • Github Repository
        Pros
      • Provide contact list management features (manage multiple contact lists)
      • Allow design of emails in application (WYSYWIG Editor)
      • Allow upload of HTML template in application (Copy & Paste)
      • Allow emails to be sent out - System has this feature but I haven't successfully sent.
      • Ability to provide attachments (custom or single attachment)
      • Store newsletter statistics (delivery success / failures)
      • Permissions for sending, managing contact list, and editing / creating newsletters - Currently Admin Account
        Cons
      • Login with NYC.ID
      • Based on Amazon SES, so account is limited by Amazon.

    4. Newsletter management for the Django webframework

      • Github Repository
        Pros
      • Provide contact list management features (manage multiple contact lists)
      • Allow emails to be sent out - Send emails through own Server, Mandrillm, Mailgun.
      • Permissions for sending, managing contact list, and editing / creating newsletters - admin account to manage
        Cons
      • Login with NYC.ID - Does not support NYC.ID
      • Allow upload of HTML template in application - No support.
      • Ability to provide attachments - No support.
      • Store newsletter statistics (delivery success / failures) - No support.
      • Allow design of emails in application (WYSYWIG Editor) - No support.

    5. mailtrain

      • V1 Github Repository
        Project V2 under Beta development
        Frontend built on Node.js (Probably out)
        Pros
      • Provide contact list management features -manage multiple contact lists and upload existing file
      • Ability to provide attachments.
      • Allow upload of HTML template in application - No upload but can copy & paste.
      • Allow emails to be sent out
      • Allow design of emails in application (WYSYWIG Editor)
      • Permissions for sending, managing contact list, and editing / creating newsletters - admin account to manage
        Cons
      • Login with NYC.ID - Does not support NYC.ID
      • Store newsletter statistics (delivery success / failures) - No support.
